implementationCheckerObject.title: Baseline TIFF 6.0
implementationCheckerObject.description:
Baseline TIFF (Part 1) is the core of TIFF, the essentials that all mainstream TIFF developers should support in their products.
Baseline TIFF image is capable of describing bilevel, grayscale, palette-color, and full-color RGB images.
Tiff Revision 6.0 Final - June 3, 1992
implementationCheckerObject.author: Easy Innova

rules.title: validation rules for the TIFF IFH
rules.description:
A TIFF file begins with an 8-byte image file header(IFH), containing the following information:
Bytes 0-1: The byte order used within the file. Legal values are: “II” (4949.H) for little-endian and “MM” (4D4D.H) for big-endian. Bytes 2-3: An arbitrary but carefully chosen number (42) that further identifies the file as aTIFF file. Bytes 4-7: The offset (in bytes) of the first IFD. The directory may be at any location in the file after the header but must begin on a word boundary.

rule.title: TIFF file begins with an IFH
rule.description: A TIFF file begins with an 8-byte Image File Header(IFH) that points to and image file directory(IFD)
rule.assert: TIFF must start with an unique Image File Header

rule.title: TIFF IFH contains the byte order
rule.description: TIFF Image File Header(IFH) must contain the byte order used within the file (IFD Bytes 0 to 1). Legal values are "II" for Little Endian or "MM" for Big Endian byte order
rule.assert: Byte Order must be defined

rule.title: TIFF IFH contains a valid byte order
rule.description: TIFF Image File Header(IFH) must contain the byte order used within the file (IFD Bytes 0 to 1). Legal values are "II" for Little endian or "MM" for Big Endian byte order
rule.assert: Byte Order must be BIG_ENDIAN or LITTLE_ENDIAN

rule.title: IFH contains the TIFF signature
rule.description: TIFF Image File Header(IFH) must contain the number 42 (IFD Bytes 2 to 3). An arbitrary but carefully chosen number that further identifies the file as a TIFF file.
rule.assert: TIFF signature must be defined

rule.title: TIFF signature is the number 42
rule.description: TIFF Image File Header(IFH) must contain the number 42 (IFD Bytes 2 to 3). An arbitrary but carefully chosen number that further identifies the file as a TIFF file.
rule.assert: TIFF signature is not correct (The TIFF signature must be 42)

rule.title: First IFD offset refers out of the file
rule.description: The byte offset of the first IFD may refer at any location in the file after the Image File Header(IFH), respect to the beginning of the TIFF file.
rule.assert: First IFD bad offset position out of TIFF file, probably corrupted file.

rule.title: First IFD offset refers inside the IFH
rule.description: The byte offset of the first IFD may refer at any location in the file after the Image File Header(IFH)
rule.assert: First IFD bad offset position inside the Image File Header(IFH), probably corrupted file.

rule.title: First IFD offset begin on a word boundary
rule.description: The byte offset may refer at any location in the file after the Image File Header(IFH) but must begin on a word boundary
rule.assert: Bad word alignment in offset
rule.hint: You can use the metadata fixer option Make Baseline Compliant to solve this error.

rules.title: validation rules for the TIFF Image File Directory(IFD)
rules.description: An Image File Directory (IFD) consists of a 2-byte count of the number of directory entries (i.e., the number of fields), followed by a sequence of 12-byte field entries, followed by a 4-byte offset of the next IFD (or 0 if none). There must be at least 1 IFD in a TIFF file and each IFD must have at least one entry.

rule.title: TIFF file must have at least one IFD
rule.description: There must be at least one Image File Directory(IFD) in a TIFF file and each IDF must have at least one entry
rule.assert: TIFF file must have at least one Image File Directory

rule.title: IFD must have at least one entry
rule.description: There must be at least one Image File Directory(IFD) in a TIFF file and each IDF must have at least one entry
rule.assert: Image File Directory must have at least one entry

rule.title: IFD must have at least one entry
rule.description: There must be at least one Image File Directory(IFD) in a TIFF file and each IDF must have at least one entry
rule.assert: Image File Directory must have at least one entry

rule.title: IFD must have at least one entry
rule.description: There must be at least one Image File Directory(IFD) in a TIFF file and each IDF must have at least one entry
rule.assert: Image File Directory must have at least one entry

rule.title: Number of directory entry not match with the file entries
rule.description: Number of directory entry not match with the file entries
rule.assert: Number of directory entry must be the same that the directories entries

rule.title: Duplicate tag inside one IDF
rule.description: The entries in an Image File Directory(IFD) must be in strictly ascending order by tag although the values witch directory entry points need not be in any particular order.
rule.assert: Tags cannot be duplicated inside an IFD because the entries in an Image File Directory(IFD) must be in strictly ascending order
rule.hint: You can use the metadata fixer option Make Baseline Compliant to solve this error.

rule.title: IFD entry must be sorted in strictly ascending order
rule.description: The entries in an Image File Directory(IFD) must be in strictly ascending order by tag although the values witch directory entry points need not be in any particular order.
rule.assert: Tags must be in strict ascending order
rule.hint: You can use the metadata fixer option Make Baseline Compliant to solve this error.

rule.title: IFD entry must have a cardinality
rule.description: An entries in an Image File Directory(IFD) must have a cardinality greater than zero.
rule.assert: IDF entry with invalid cardinality

rule.title: IFD offset refers to a location out of the file
rule.description: The byte offset of the first IFD may refer at any location in the file after the Image File Header(IFH), respect to the beginning of the TIFF file.
rule.assert: IFD bad offset position refers to a location out of the file, probably corrupted file.

rule.title: IFD offset refers to a location inside the IFH
rule.description: The byte offset of the first IFD may refer at any location in the file after the Image File Header(IFH)
rule.assert: IFD bad offset position refers to a location inside the Image File Header(IFH), probably corrupted file.

rule.title: Last IFD offset must be 4 bytes of 0
rule.description: The last IFD offset must be 4 bites of 0
rule.assert: The Last IFD offset must be 4 bites of 0

rule.title: IFD offset begin on a word boundary
rule.description: The byte offset may refer at any location in the file after the Image File Header(IFH) but must begin on a word boundary
rule.assert: Bad word alignment in offset
rule.hint: You can use the metadata fixer option Make Baseline Compliant to solve this error.

rule.title: EXIF IFD offset begin on a word boundary
rule.description: The byte offset may refer at any location in the file after the Image File Header(IFH) but must begin on a word boundary
rule.assert: Bad word alignment in offset
rule.hint: You can use the metadata fixer option Make Baseline Compliant to solve this error.

rule.title: IFD circular reference
rule.description: Next Image File Directory(IFD) offset should not refers to a previous IFD because no data should be referenced form more than one place.
rule.assert: Image File Directory offset refers to a previous IFD creating circular reference

rule.title: More than 10 private tags in one IFD
rule.description: If you need more than 10 tags, we suggest that you reserve a single private tag and use its value as a pointer (offset) to a private IFD or other data structure of your choosing. Within that IFD, you can use whatever tags you want, since no one else will know that it is an IFD unless you tell them.
rule.assert: More than 10 private tags in one IFD

rule.title: More than 1 on IFD in the TIFF file
rule.description: There may be more than one IFD in a TIFF file but for Baseline TIFF readers is not required to read any IFDs beyond the first one, so not all readers could render all the images in the file
rule.assert: There is more than one IFD in the TIFF file. some readers will only render the first one

rule.title: Check valid extra samples components
rule.description: Check valid extra samples components
rule.assert: Incorrect Extra Samples Count

rule.title: Check not unused extra samples present
rule.description: Check not unused extra samples present
rule.assert: Unnecessary Extra Samples

rule.title: Check valid Bits per Sample values
rule.description: Check valid Bits per Sample values
rule.assert: Invalid Bits per Sample

rules.title: Validation rules for the TIFF Image File Directory Entry(IFD)
rules.description:
Each 12-byte IFD entry has the following format:
Bytes 0-1 The Tag that identifies the field. Bytes 2-3 The field Type. Bytes 4-7 The number of values, Count of the indicated Type. Bytes 8-11 The Value Offset, the file offset (in bytes) of the Value for the field.
The Value is expected to begin on a word boundary; the corresponding Value Offset will thus be an even number. This file offset may point anywhere in the file, even after the image data.

rule.title: invalid IFDE type
rule.description:
The field types and their sizes are:
1 = BYTE 8-bit unsigned integer. 2 = ASCII 8-bit byte that contains a 7-bit ASCII code; the last byte must be NUL (binary zero). 3 = SHORT 16-bit (2-byte) unsigned integer. 4 = LONG 32-bit (4-byte) unsigned integer. 5 = RATIONAL Two LONGs: the first represents the numerator of a fraction; the second, the denominator. 6 = SBYTE An 8-bit signed (twos-complement) integer. 7 = UNDEFINED An 8-bit byte that may contain anything, depending on the definition of the field. 8 = SSHORT A 16-bit (2-byte) signed (twos-complement) integer. 9 = SLONG A 32-bit (4-byte) signed (twos-complement) integer. 10 = SRATIONAL Two SLONG’s: the first represents the numerator of a fraction, the second the denominator. 11 = FLOAT Single precision (4-byte) IEEE format. 12 = DOUBLE Double precision (8-byte) IEEE format.
To store a complicated data structure in a private tag, use the UNDEFINED field type and set the Count to the number of bytes required to hold the data structure.
rule.assert: Invalid TIFF type, this type is not defined in the Baseline 6.0

rule.title: Valid ASCII characters
rule.description: 8-bit byte that contains a 7-bit ASCII code; the last byte must be NUL (binary zero).
rule.assert: Only 7-bit ASCII codes are accepted
rule.hint: Modify the tag content with basic ascii characters (no accents).

rule.title: ASCII strings terminated with NUL (binary zero)
rule.description: Any ASCII field can contain multiple strings, each terminated with a NUL. A single string is preferred whenever possible. The Count for multi-string fields is the number of bytes in all the strings in that field plus their terminating NUL bytes.
rule.assert: ASCII strings must terminate with NUL

rule.title: Only one NUL is allowed between ASCII strings
rule.description: Only one NUL is allowed between strings, so that the strings following the first string will often begin on an odd byte.
rule.assert: Only one NUL is allowed between ASCII strings

rules.title: Validation rules for an image IFD
rules.description: This section contains all the common rules for and image IFD

rule.title: An image IFD must have a Photometric Interpretation
rule.description: There is no default value for Photometric Interpretation tag, so it is required for an Image File Directory that contains and image data
rule.assert: An Image IFD must have a Photometric Interpretation tag

rule.title: An image IFD must have a Image Length
rule.description: An image Image File Directory(IFD) that contains and image data must have a Image Length value
rule.assert: Image IFD must have a Length tag

rule.title: An image IFD must have a Image Width
rule.description: An image Image File Directory(IFD) that contains and image data must have a Image Width value
rule.assert: Image IFD must have a Width tag

rule.title: An image IFD must have a X Resolution value
rule.description: An Image File Directory(IFD) that contains and image data must have a X Resolution value
rule.assert: Image IFD must have tag X Resolution

rule.title: An image IFD must have a Y Resolution value
rule.description: An Image File Directory(IFD) that contains and image data must have a Y Resolution value
rule.assert: Image IFD must have tag Y Resolution

rule.title: Valid BitsPerSample and SamplesPerPixel
rule.description: The total number of BitsPerSample must be the same as SamplesPerPixel
rule.assert: BitsPerSample cardinality must match with SamplesPerPixel

rule.title: Ifd with ExtraSamples
rule.description: When and Extra Sample is defined then BitsPerSample and SamplesPerPixel must be defined.
rule.assert: BitsPerSample and SamplesPerPixel must be defined when an ExtraSample is declared

rules.title: Strips Images
rules.description: Compressed or uncompressed image data can be stored almost anywhere in a TIFF file. TIFF also supports breaking an image into separate strips for increased editing flexibility and efficient I/O buffering. The location and size of each strip is given by the following fields; StripOffsets, StripBYTECount, RowsPerStrip.

rule.title: An image IFD should have a StripOffsets
rule.description: An Image File Directory(IFD) that contains and image data must have StripOffsets values
rule.assert: Image IFD must have the tag StripOffsets
rule.hint: Regenerate the image with strips, or if you accept tiles validate with the Extended Baseline standard

rule.title: An image IFD should have a StripBYTECount
rule.description: An Image File Directory(IFD) that contains and image data must have StripBYTECount
rule.assert: Image IFD must have the tag StripBYTECount
rule.hint: Regenerate the image with strips, or if you accept tiles validate with the Extended Baseline standard

rule.title: Strips sizes match image dimensions
rule.description: strips structure must match with the image width and height
rule.assert: Image width and image height do not match with strips sizes

rule.title: Strips check
rule.description: Strips must be valid
rule.assert: Strips offsets are invalid

rule.title: Inconsistent Strip lenght
rule.description: The cardinality of striptOffsets and the cardinality of StripsBytesCount must be the same
rule.assert: Inconsistent strip lengths, The cardinality of striptOffsets and StripsBytesCount must match

rules.title: Validation rules for IFD Image Bilevel (Class B)
rules.description:
A bilevel image contains two colors—black and white. TIFF allows an application to write out bilevel data in either a white-is-zero or black-is-zero format.
Baseline TIFF bilevel images were called TIFF Class B images in earlier versions of the TIFF specification.

rule.title: Valid Photometric Interpretation value
rule.description: The Photometric Interpretation tag for bilevel images must have a valid value. 0 = WhiteIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as white. 1 = BlackIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as black.
rule.assert: Photometric Interpretation value must be 0 or 1

rule.title: Valid image compression
rule.description: The compression tag for bilevel images must have a valid value. 1 = No compression. 2 = CCITT Group 3 1-Dimensional Modified Huffman run length encoding. 32773 = PackBits compression, a simple byte-oriented run length scheme.
rule.assert: Invalid Compression for Bilevel image
rule.hint: Regenerate the image without compression, or if you accept compressed images, validate with the Extended Baseline standard

rule.title: Valid BitsPerSample and SamplesPerPixel
rule.description: When No Extra Sample is defined then BitsPerSample cardinality and SamplesPerPixel must be 1 for Bilevel Images.
rule.assert: BitsPerSample and BitsPerSample should be 1 for Bilevel images without ExtraSamples

rule.title: Valid BitsPerSample and SamplesPerPixel with ExtraSample
rule.description: When an Extra Sample is defined 1 sample is required for Bilevel Images.
rule.assert: When an Extra Sample is defined 1 sample is required for Bilevel Images.

rule.title: Bilevel image display reversed
rule.description: When in a Bilevel image 0 is imaged as black and 2**BitsPerSample-1 is imaged as white. If Compression is 2 (CCITT Group 3 1-Dimensional Modified Huffman run-length encoding) the image should display and print reversed.
rule.assert: Some TIFF readers could display a Bilevel image compressed with CCITT reversed colors

rules.title: Validation rules for IFD Image Grayscale (Class G)
rules.description:
Grayscale images are a generalization of bilevel images. Bilevel images can store only black and white image data, but grayscale images can also store shades of gray.
Baseline TIFF grayscale images were called TIFF Class G images in earlier versions of the TIFF specification.

rule.title: Valid Photometric Interpretation value
rule.description: The Photometric Interpretation tag for grayscale images must have a valid value. 0 = WhiteIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as white. 1 = BlackIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as black.
rule.assert: Photometric Interpretation value must be 0 or 1

rule.title: Valid compression for grayscale image
rule.description: In Baseline TIFF, grayscale images can either be stored as uncompressed data or compressed with the PackBits algorithm
rule.assert: Invalid Compression for Grayscale image

rule.title: Grayscale image with PackBits Compression
rule.description: PackBits is often ineffective on continuous tone images, including many grayscale images. In such cases, it is better to leave the image uncompressed.
rule.assert: PackBits is often ineffective on grayscale images. It is better to leave the image uncompressed.

rule.title: Valid bits per sample and samples per Pixel
rule.description: When No Extra Sample is defined then BitsPerSample must be 4 or 8 and SamplesPerPixel must be 1 for Grayscale Images.
rule.assert: BitsPerSample must be 4 or 8 and BitsPerSample must be 1 for Grayscale images without ExtraSamples

rule.title: Valid BitsPerSample and SamplesPerPixel with ExtraSample
rule.description: When an Extra Sample is defined then 1 sample is required for Grayscale Images.
rule.assert: 1 sample is required to define Grayscale images with ExtraSamples

rules.title: Validation rules for IFD Image Palette Color
rules.description:
Palette-color have one component per pixel, but the component value is used as an index into a full RGB-lookup table.
Baseline TIFF palette-color images were called TIFF Class P images in earlier versions of the TIFF specification.

rule.title: Valid Photometric Interpretation value
rule.description: The Photometric Interpretation tag for Palette Color images must have a valid value. 3 = Palette Color.
rule.assert: Photometric Interpretation value must be 3

rule.title: Valid compression for palette color image
rule.description: In Baseline TIFF, palette color images can either be stored as uncompressed data or compressed with the PackBits algorithm.
rule.assert: Invalid Compression for palette color image

rule.title: Valid BitsPerSample for palette color image
rule.description: Allowable values for Baseline TIFF palette color images are 4 and 8, allowing either 16 or 256 distinct colors.
rule.assert: Invalid Bits per Sample for palette color image

rule.title: Palette image SamplesPerPixel must be 1
rule.description: Palette image can not contain ExtraSamples SamplesPerPixel must be 1.
rule.assert: Palette image can not contain ExtraSamples, SamplesPerPixel must be 1.

rule.title: Color Map is required for palette color image
rule.description: This field defines a Red-Green-Blue color map (often called a lookup table) for palette color images. In a TIFF ColorMap, all the Red values come first, followed by the Green values, then the Blue values. In the ColorMap, black is represented by 0,0,0 and white is represented by 65535, 65535, 65535.
rule.assert: Color Map must be included in palette color images

rules.title: Validation rules for RGB Full color images
rules.description:
In an RGB image, each pixel is made up of three components: red, green, and blue. There is no ColorMap. To describe an RGB image, you need to add or change the following fields and values. The other required fields are the same as those required for palette-color images.
The BitsPerSample values listed above apply only to the main image data. If ExtraSamples are present, the appropriate BitsPerSample values for those samples must also be included.
Baseline TIFF RGB images were called TIFF Class R images in earlier versions of the TIFF specification.

rule.title: Valid Photometric Interpretation value for RGB image
rule.description: The Photometric Interpretation tag for RGB images must have a valid value. 2 = RGB.
rule.assert: Photometric Interpretation value must be 2

rule.title: Valid compression for RGB image
rule.description: In Baseline TIFF, RGB images can either be stored as uncompressed data or compressed with the PackBits algorithm.
rule.assert: Invalid Compression for RGB image
rule.hint: Regenerate the image without compression, or if you accept compression validate with the Extended Baseline standard

rule.title: RGB image with PackBits Compression
rule.description: PackBits is often ineffective on continuous tone images, including many RGB images. In such cases, it is better to leave the image uncompressed.
rule.assert: PackBits is often ineffective on RGB images. It is better to leave the image uncompressed.

rule.title: Valid bits per sample and samples per Pixel
rule.description: When No Extra Sample is defined then BitsPerSample must be 4 or 8 and SamplesPerPixel must be 3 for palette colo Images.
rule.assert: BitsPerSample must be 4 or 8 and BitsPerSample must be 3 for palette color image wihout ExtraSamples

rule.title: Valid BitsPerSample and SamplesPerPixel with ExtraSample
rule.description: When an Extra Sample is defined then 3 sample is required for RGB Images.
rule.assert: 3 samples are required to define RGB images with ExtraSamples

rules.title: Validation rules for IFD with alpha transparency
rules.description: Validation rules for IFD with alpha transparency

rule.title: Valid Photometric Interpretation value
rule.description:
The Photometric Interpretation tag for Transparency mask must have a valid value. 4 = Transparency Mask.
This means that the image is used to define an irregularly shaped region of another image in the same TIFF file.
rule.assert: Photometric Interpretation value must be 4

rule.title: Valid BitsPerSample for Transparency Mask
rule.description: For Transparency Mask SamplesPerPixel and BitsPerSample must be 1. The 1-bits define the interior of the region and the 0-bits define the exterior of the region
rule.assert: Invalid Bits per Sample for Transparency Mask image

rule.title: valid SamplesPerPixel for Transparency Mask
rule.description: For Transparency Mask SamplesPerPixel and BitsPerSample must be 1. The 1-bits define the interior of the region and the 0-bits define the exterior of the region
rule.assert: Invalid Samples per Pixel for Transparency Mask image

rule.title: Compression for Transparency Mask
rule.description: PackBits compression is recommended for Transparency Mask
rule.assert: PackBits compression is recommended for Transparency Mask

rules.title: validation rules for TIFF Offsets
rules.description:
No Duplicate Pointers. No data should be referenced from more than one place. TIFF readers and editors are under no obligation to detect this condition and handle it properly. This would not be a problem if TIFF files were read-only entities, but they are not. This warning covers both TIFF field value offsets and fields that are defined as offsets, such as StripOffsets.
Point to real data. All strip offsets must reference valid locations. (It is not legal to use an offset of 0 to mean something special.)

rule.title: Offset begin on a word boundary
rule.description: The byte offset may refer at any location in the file after the Image File Header(IFH) but must begin on a word boundary
rule.assert: Bad word alignment in offset
rule.hint: You can use the metadata fixer option Make Baseline Compliant to solve this error.

rule.title: Offset refers to a location out of the file
rule.description: The byte offset may refer ar any location in the file after the Image File Header(IFH), respect to the beginning of the TIFF file.
rule.assert: Bad offset position, probably corrupted file.

rule.title: Offset refers to a location inside the IFH
rule.description: The byte offset may refer ar any location in the file after the Image File Header(IFH)
rule.assert: Bad offset position

rule.title: Duplicate pointers
rule.description: No data should be referenced form more than one place. This warning covers both TIFF field value offsets and fields that are defined as offsets
rule.assert: Duplicate pointer

rule.title: Data already referenced
rule.description: No data should be referenced form more than one place. This warning covers both TIFF field value offsets and fields that are defined as offsets
rule.assert: Data already referenced

rules.title: Artist
rules.description:
Person who created the image.
Tag = 315 (13B.H) Type = ASCII No default
Note: some older TIFF files used this tag for storing Copyright information.

rule.title: Artist tag valid Type
rule.description: Artist Tag type must be ASCII
rule.assert: Artist Tag type is not valid, an ASCII type is expected

rule.title: Artist storing Copyright information
rule.description: Some older TIFF files used this tag for storing Copyright information
rule.assert: Some older TIFF files used this tag for storing Copyright information.

rules.title: BitsPerSample
rules.description:
Number of bits per component. This field allows a different number of bits per component for each component corresponding to a pixel.
Tag = 258 (102.H) Type = SHORT N = SamplesPerPixel Default = 1

rule.title: BitsPerSample valid Type
rule.description: BitsPerSample Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: BitsPerSample type is not valid, an SHORT type is expected

rule.title: BitsPerSample valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the number of bits per componet must be the same as SamplesPerPixel value
rule.assert: BitsPerSample must have a cardinality according to BitsPerSample

rule.title: BitsPerSample requires and image IFD
rule.description: BitsPerSample should only be used in an image IFD
rule.assert: BitsPerSample should only be used in an image IFD

rule.title: BitsPerSample default value
rule.description: BitsPerSample tag has a default value, if it is not present value 1 bit per sample is assumed.
rule.assert: BitsPerSample Tag is not defined. Then 1 bit per sample is assumed.

rules.title: CellLength
rules.description:
The length of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file.
Tag = 265 (109.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 No default
This field should only be present if Threshholding = 2

rule.title: CellLength valid Type
rule.description: CellLength Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: CellLength type is not valid, an SHORT type is expected

rule.title: CellLength valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the CellLength tag must be 1
rule.assert: CellLength must have a 1 cardinality

rule.title: CellLength tag only if Threshholding is 2
rule.description: CellLength should only be present if Threshholding is 2
rule.assert: CellLength should only be present if Threshholding is 2

rule.title: CellLength only in Bilevel images
rule.description: CellLength should only be used in an image IFD defining a bilevel image
rule.assert: CellLength should only be used in an image IFD defining a bilevel image

rules.title: CellWidth
rules.description:
The width of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file.
Tag = 264 (109.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 No default
This field should only be present if Threshholding = 2

rule.title: CellWidth valid Type
rule.description: CellWidth Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: CellWidth type is not valid, an SHORT type is expected

rule.title: CellWidth valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the CellWidth tag must be 1
rule.assert: CellWidth must have a 1 cardinality

rule.title: CellWidth tag only if Threshholding is 2
rule.description: CellWidth should only be present if Threshholding is 2
rule.assert: CellWidth should only be present if Threshholding is 2

rule.title: CellWidth only in bilevel images
rule.description: CellWidth should only be used in an image IFD defining a bilevel image
rule.assert: CellWidth should only be used in an image IFD defining a bilevel image

rules.title: ColorMap
rules.description:
A color map for palette color images. This field defines a Red-Green-Blue color map (often called a lookup table) for palette-color images. In a palette-color image, a pixel value is used to index into an RGB lookup table.
In a TIFF ColorMap, all the Red values come first, followed by the Green values, then the Blue values. The number of values for each color is 2**BitsPerSample. Therefore, the ColorMap field for an 8-bit palette-color image would have 3 * 256 values. The width of each value is 16 bits, as implied by the type of SHORT. 0 represents the minimum intensity, and 65535 represents the maximum intensity. Black is represented by 0,0,0, and white by 65535, 65535, 65535. ColorMap must be included in all palette-color images.
Tag = 320 (140.H) Type = SHORT N = 3 * (2**BitsPerSample) No default

rule.title: ColorMap valid Type
rule.description: ColorMap Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: ColorMap type is not valid, a SHORT type is expected

rule.title: ColorMap valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the ColorMap tag must be 3 * (2**BitsPerSample)
rule.assert: The cardinality of the ColorMap tag must be 3 * (2**BitsPerSample)

rule.title: ColorMap only in palette images
rule.description: ColorMap should only be used in an image IFD defining a palette image
rule.assert: ColorMap should only be used in an image IFD defining a palette image

rules.title: Compression
rules.description:
Compression scheme used on the image data.
Tag = 259 (103.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default = 1
Currently defined values are: 1 = No compression 2 = CCITT Group 3 1-Dimensional Modified Huffman run-length encoding. this type of compression is defined only for bilevel images. 32773 = PackBits compression, a simple byte-oriented run-length scheme.

rule.title: Compression valid Type
rule.description: Compression Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: Compression type is not valid, an SHORT type is expected

rule.title: Compression valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the Compression tag must be 1
rule.assert: Compression must have a 1 cardinality

rule.title: Valid Compression value
rule.description: The Compression tag must have a valid value. 1 = No compression 2 = CCITT Group 3 1-Dimensional Modified Huffman run-length encoding. 32773 = PackBits compression, a simple byte-oriented run-length scheme
rule.assert: The Compression tag must have a valid value
rule.hint: Regenerate the image without compression, or if you accept compression validate with the Extended Baseline standard

rule.title: Compression CCITT for bilevel images
rule.description: CCITT Group 3 1-Dimensional Modified Huffman run-length encoding compression is defined only for bilevel images and BitsPerSample must be 1
rule.assert: CCITT compression is defined only for bilevel images and BitsPerSample must be 1

rule.title: Compression requires and image ifd
rule.description: Compression should only be used in an image IFD
rule.assert: Compression should only be used in an image IFD

rules.title: FillOrder
rules.description:
The logical order of bits within a byte.
Tag = 266 (10A.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default is 1.
Currently defined values are: 1 = pixels are arranged within a byte such that pixels with lower column values are stored in the higher-order bits of the byte. 2 = pixels are arranged within a byte such that pixels with lower column values are stored in the lower-order bits of the byte.
We recommend that FillOrder=2 be used only in special-purpose applications. It is easy and inexpensive for writers to reverse bit order by using a 256-byte lookup table. FillOrder = 2 should be used only when BitsPerSample = 1 and the data is either uncompressed or compressed using CCITT 1D or 2D compression, to avoid potentially ambigous situations. Support for FillOrder=2 is not required in a Baseline TIFF compliant reader

rule.title: FillOrder tag valid Type
rule.description: FillOrder Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: FillOrder Tag type is not valid, a SHORT type is expected

rule.title: FillOrder valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the FillOrder tag must be 1
rule.assert: FillOrder cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be 1

rule.title: FillOrder pixels arrange in lower-order
rule.description: FillOrder pixels are arranged within a byte such that pixels with lower column values are stored in the lower-order bits of the byte. This configuration should only be used in special-purpose applications. Support for FillOrder=2 is not required in a Baseline TIFF compliant reader.
rule.assert: FillOrder with value 2 should only be used in special-purpose applications. Support for FillOrder=2 is not required in a Baseline TIFF compliant reader

rule.title: FillOrder invalid pixels arrange in lower-order

rules.title: NewSubfileType
rules.description:
A general indication of the kind of data contained in this subfile. Replaces the old SubfileType field, due to limitations in the definition of that field. NewSubfileType is mainly useful when there are multiple subfiles in a single TIFF file. This field is made up of a set of 32 flag bits. Unused bits are expected to be 0. Bit 0 is the low-order bit.
Tag = 254 (FE.H) Type = LONG N = 1 Default is 0.
Currently defined values are: Bit 0 is 1 if the image is a reduced-resolution version of another image in this TIFF file; else the bit is 0. Bit 1 is 1 if the image is a single page of a multi-page image (see the PageNumber field description); else the bit is 0. Bit 2 is 1 if the image defines a transparency mask for another image in this TIFF file. The PhotometricInterpretation value must be 4, designating a transparency mask.
These values are defined as bit flags because they are independent of each other.

rule.title: NewSubfileType match with the image type

rules.title: PhotometricInterpretation
rules.description:
The color space of the image data.
Tag = 262 (106.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 No default
Currently defined values are: 0 = WhiteIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as white. 2**BitsPerSample-1 is imaged as black. 1 = BlackIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as black. 2**BitsPerSample-1 is imaged as white. 2 = RGB. In the RGB model, a color is described as a combination of the three primary colors of light (red, green, and blue) in particular concentrations. 3 = Palette color. 4 = Transparency Mask.
There is no default for PhotometricInterpretation, and it is required. Do not rely on applications defaulting to what you want.

rule.title: PhotometricInterpretation tag valid Type
rule.description: PhotometricInterpretation Tag type must be SHORT
rule.assert: PhotometricInterpretation Tag type is not valid, a SHORT type is expected

rule.title: PhotometricInterpretation valid cardinality
rule.description: The cardinality of the PhotometricInterpretation tag must be 1
rule.assert: PhotometricInterpretation cardinality is not valid, cardinality should be 1

rule.title: Valid Photometric Interpretation value
rule.description:
The Photometric Interpretation tag must have a valid value.
0 = WhiteIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as white. 1 = BlackIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as black. 2 = RGB. RGB value of (0,0,0) represents black, and (255,255,255) represents white, assuming 8-bit components. The components are stored in the indicated order: first Red, then Green, then Blue. 3 = Palette color. In this model, a color is described with a single component. The value of the component is used as an index into the red, green and blue curves in the ColorMap field to retrieve an RGB triplet that defines the color. When PhotometricInterpretation=3 is used, ColorMap must be present and SamplesPerPixel must be 1. 4 = Transparency Mask. This means that the image is used to define an irregularly shaped region of another image in the same TIFF file. SamplesPerPixel and BitsPerSample must be 1. PackBits compression is recommended. The 1-bits define the interior of the region; the 0-bits define the exterior of the region.
rule.assert: Photometric Interpretation value must be between 0 and 4

rule.title: PhotometricInterpretation requires and image ifd
rule.description: PhotometricInterpretation should only be used in an image IFD
rule.assert: PhotometricInterpretation should only be used in an image IFD

rules.title: PlanarConfiguration
rules.description:
How the components of each pixel are stored.
Tag = 284 (11C.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default is 1
Currently defined values are: 1 = Chunky format. The component values for each pixel are stored contiguously. 2 = Planar format. The components are stored in separate “component planes.”
PlanarConfiguration=2 is not currently in widespread use and it is not recommended for general interchange. It is used as an extension and Baseline TIFF readers are not required to support it. If SamplesPerPixel is 1, PlanarConfiguration is irrelevant, and need not be included.

rules.title: StripOffsets
rules.description:
For each strip, the byte offset of that strip.
Tag = 273 (111.H) Type = SHORT or LONG N = StripsPerImage for PlanarConfiguration equal to 1 or SamplesPerPixel * StripsPerImage for PlanarConfiguration equal to 2 No default.
The offset is specified with respect to the beginning of the TIFF file. Note that this implies that each strip has a location independent of the locations of other strips. This feature may be useful for editing applications. This required field is the only way for a reader to find the image data.
Note that either SHORT or LONG values may be used to specify the strip offsets. SHORT values may be used for small TIFF files. It should be noted, however, that earlier TIFF specifications required LONG strip offsets and that some software may not accept SHORT values.
For maximum compatibility with operating systems such as MS-DOS and Windows, the StripOffsets array should be less than or equal to 64K bytes in length, and the strips themselves, in both compressed and uncompressed forms, should not be larger than 64K bytes. No default.

rules.title: SubfileType
rules.description:
A general indication of the kind of data contained in this subfile.
Tag = 255 (FF.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 No default
Currently defined values are: 1 = full-resolution image data 2 = reduced-resolution image data 3 = a single page of a multi-page image (see the PageNumber field description).
Note that several image types may be found in a single TIFF file, with each subfile described by its own IFD. This field is deprecated. The NewSubfileType field should be used instead.

rules.title: Threshholding
rules.description:
For black and white TIFF files that represent shades of gray, the technique used to convert from gray to black and white pixels.
Tag = 263 (107.H) Type = SHORT N = 1 Default is 1
Currently defined values are: 1 = No dithering or halftoning has been applied to the image data. 2 = An ordered dither or halftone technique has been applied to the image data. 3 = A randomized process such as error diffusion has been applied to the image data.
